title: HistoGuesser Figure Candidates
description: Schema for AI-generated historical figure candidate lists. Generate batches of ~25 figures per category.

aliases.description: Common name variations, nicknames, alternate spellings

birth_year.description: Birth year (negative for BCE, e.g., -356 for 356 BCE)

death_year.description: Death year or null if still living

hometown.description: Birthplace using modern city/country names (e.g., 'Ulm, Germany')

description.description: 50-100 word description blending humor and facts. Should be engaging for a game context.

category.description: Primary category (must be one of the 8 game categories)

difficulty.description: How well-known this figure is. Easy = household name, Hard = specialist knowledge.

tags.description: Additional descriptive tags (e.g., ['president', 'founding_father']). First tag should match category.

wikipedia_page.description: Exact Wikipedia article title (e.g., 'Alexander_Hamilton'). Used for validation.

candidates.name: Alexander Hamilton
candidates.description: The original 'immigrant who got the job done.' Hamilton went from Caribbean orphan to America's first Treasury Secretary, creating the financial system, founding the Coast Guard, and somehow finding time to write 51 of the 85 Federalist Papers. His rivalry with Aaron Burr ended exactly how you'd expect a political feud to end in the 1800s.
